blog.name: doctorstark
blog.description: we cannot bury one without the other

summary: tony: yeah, sure, i'm manly. a Mans Man. watching the lion king without crying?? a piece of cake. what is crying. i've never...
body:
tony: yeah, sure, i’m manly. a Mans Man. watching the lion king without crying?? a piece of cake. what is crying. i’ve never cried in my entire life.

tony three second later: pepper can we please have a baby please please please?? pretty please with a cherry on top?? sprinkles?? chocolate syrup?? what more do you want from me woman

tony three second later: pepper can we please have a baby please please please?? pretty please with a cherry on top?? sprinkles?? chocolate syrup?? what more do you want from me woman

blog.name: marveluheadcanon
blog.title: MarvelUHeadcanons
blog.description: Headcanons from all over the Marvel universe. Sister to DCuHeadcanon. Submissions now open!

body:
22.

Steve Rogers is basically immortal. The Super Soldier Serim keeps him eternally young and immune to disease. It really pisses off Tony.

tags: peter parker will be in this
summary: Instead of Christine Everheart meeting Tony at the start of Iron Man, we get Tony and Stephen meet-cute. Stephen's in Malibu for...
body:
Instead of Christine Everheart meeting Tony at the start of Iron Man, we get Tony and Stephen meet-cute. Stephen’s in Malibu for a Doctor’s fundraiser/award ceremony or something and Tony’s there for the same reason as he is in the movie.

End result: they somehow get married during the night, which is possible since Las Vegas is only 4 hours (excluding traffic) from Malibu. They could totally do a fly by in one of Tony’s jets and be back within 2 hrs, since the flight takes an hour to get there.

Although, my thing would be that they never really tell anyone except Pepper, Happy, Rhodey and Christine since it wasn’t really a priority. Happy was their witness when they went to Las Vegas 🔔💍.

This is a fic in the works as of right now. Thank you for listening to my Ted-Talk. Now here’s a taste of what it’s shaping out to be.

~•●•~

Stephen hadn’t planned on going to the casino, but when it came to Christine Palmer- Stephen had no defense to combat her. She was a force to be reckoned with and when she got it in her head to go to a casino, well, he couldn’t very well let her go by herself. Not when she came all this way to listen to him ‘brag about himself.’

Her words, not his.

So, after the award ceremony, Stephen trailed behind Christine, still in his overpriced suit and her in a fire engine red dress, her hair artfully tucked over a bare shoulder. Stephen wished he still felt something towards her that wasn’t just respect and fondness. It’d make life easier for him if he felt about her the same way he felt for men. And besides, Christine wasn’t only just there to gamble.

The casino was loud and bright. Obnoxious. Stephen got so swept up in the lights and the people, he failed to notice Christine slipping away. When he did realize, it was too late to call out, she was completely out of sight and Stephen was completely alone. With no one to talk to and with nothing to do, he found himself wandering.

He strolled from table to table, easily sidestepping wandering hands of leery eyed woman and at one point, accidentally bumping into a moderately tall, military dressed man, the figurine he was holding painfully jabbed him in  the abdomen. With a quick apology, Stephen avoided a confrontation and headed in the opposite direction of the determined man, who continued on his way towards a table that was quickly gathering a crowd of lascivious women.

Needing a breath of fresh air from all the smoke and heavily perfumed men and women, Stephen headed back towards the exit. Somehow luck was on his side, as Stephen found himself out by a fountain. As he tried to call Christine, Stephen stepped aside for a group taking a picture in front of the fountain.

“Christine,” Stephen started when the dial tone sounded. “I don’t know where you went, but if you’re looking for me I’m heading back to the hotel. I’ll see you tomorrow morning.” As an afterthought, he tacked on a quick, “be safe.”

He hung up and turned just in time to see, a short man pass off the figurine Stephen had been jabbed with to one of the tourists taking picture. Squinting his eyes, Stephen noticed that figurine was actually an award, almost like the one he’d received a few hours earlier. The man stared after the shorter one, a confused expression on his face, which Stephen couldn’t blame him for, not when the man had also snuck himself into the photo op before heading past Stephen with a wink.

Stephen rolled his eyes and tucked his phone into his pants pocket, deciding to try and catch a cab instead of waiting for an Uber. It was Malibu, there had to be at least one free cab, especially outside a casino.

Finally making it outside, Stephen was able to take a deep breath of crisp, refreshing Malibu air. It cleared the smells of the casino right out of his sinuses, making way for the smell of traffic, distant salt water and city fumes. A distant ache for New York struck through him, as the smells brought on a sense of deja vu, bringing memories of his home. It also allowed Stephen to clear his head and focus on the task of getting back to the hotel.

The first two taxis flew by, the third and fourth turned their lights off just as he started to turn towards them and the last slowed down, but bypassed him for a pair of pretty legs in a brown pencil skirt.

“Huh. I can’t see the contest,” Stephen rolled his eyes and turned back to where the voice spoke. It was the same man who had winked at him.

He let out a short huff, “well, of course there isn’t. What kind of man pushes away that-” he gestured to the quickly disappearing blonde, then back to himself. “For this?”

The man stared for moment, his gaze assessing and something he couldn’t place lingering in those hazel-green eyes. “Unfortunately for her, I did.”

Both eyebrows rose at that, Stephen couldn’t believe a man that looked like that would pass up a chance to get laid for someone like Stephen. “Excuse me?” He couldn’t help, but step away from the road, his task of finding a taxi put on the backburner.

The man honest to god wiggled his eyebrows, ripping the shades he was wearing to make it more obvious. “How about I tell you all about back at my place?” Stephen should’ve said no, he really should’ve said no and he meant to, but the word that came out was most definitely not a no.

“Alright, but I’d like to know the man behind the mask before I sleep with them,” he stepped forward and made a bold decision to flick the man’s sunglasses.

“You really don’t know who I am?” The man grinned, and subtly snuck an arm around Stephen’s waist, gently leading him to his car, where a broad chested man stood with the back door open. He shook his head, which caused the man’s grin to widen even more. “I’m Tony Stark. Yours?”

“Doc- Stephen Strange,” he cut himself off, the habit of saying his title so ingrained in him that even saying his name to a stranger had him wanting to say it. “I’m Stephen Strange.“

End result: they somehow get married during the night, which is possible since Las Vegas is only 4 hours (excluding traffic) from Malibu. They could totally do a fly by in one of Tony’s jets and be back within 2 hrs, since the flight takes an hour to get there.

summary: *In hospital* Peter: what do I write under ‘reason for visit’? Tony: Rhodey’s concussion. *sound of pen scribbling out* Tony:...
body:
*In hospital*

Peter: what do I write under ‘reason for visit’?

Tony: Rhodey’s concussion.

*sound of pen scribbling out*

Tony: … what did you write?

Peter:

Peter: ‘Bringing someone to the hospital.’

summary: completed my first half #ironman in Tempe, AZ whoa was that water dirty but fairly easy to swim in. Did make use of my wet suit...
caption:
completed my first half #ironman in Tempe, AZ

whoa was that water dirty but fairly easy to swim in. Did make use of my wet suit though. The first transition wasn’t too bad. I saw some people taking their time and others jamming. The bike portion felt never ending with the tease of the finish at each of the three loops completed haha. Going into the run, getting off the bike was a challenge. Mostly because I struggle with clips. But my gut was not too happy. Although I had the energy to run, my gut couldn’t handle it. 

anyways I finished with an hour and a half to spare.

Mostly because I struggle with clips. But my gut was not too happy. Although I had the energy to run, my gut couldn’t handle it. 

anyways I finished with an hour and a half to spare.

blog.name: brioche-equinox
blog.title: fight me
blog.description: got 6435643 things to do and writing fanfic and blogging about gays are like 500 of them

summary: sure if you want to look at it that way the mcu could be seen as a totally shameless capitalistic marketing strategy done only...
body:
sure if you want to look at it that way the mcu could be seen as a totally shameless capitalistic marketing strategy done only to sell movie tickets, merchandise and comic books and all i have to say about that is

it’s working i just impulse bought all the comics in my amazon cart there’s no turning back now i’m in too deep

blog.name: criticaldrive7
blog.title: CriticalDrive7
blog.description: This will be a gaming video blog. It will primarily cover the Kingdom Hearts series, but it will also cover other action games occasionally.

summary:
What kind of gameplay features would you like to see in a potential Iron Man game?
I already listed some ideas, but I would like...
body:
What kind of gameplay features would you like to see in a potential Iron Man game?

I already listed some ideas, but I would like to hear from any of you what you think would make a fun Iron Man game.

For example, what boss fights would you like to see?

How long would you like the story?

Would you like a world similar to Spider-Man or something akin to MGSV?

Any opinions would be great. ^_^

I already listed some ideas, but I would like to hear from any of you what you think would make a fun Iron Man game.

For example, what boss fights would you like to see?

How long would you like the story?

Would you like a world similar to Spider-Man or something akin to MGSV?

Any opinions would be great. ^_^

title: Reciprocity
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2z3shgB

by Valiant

reciprocity:

the practice of exchanging things with others for mutual benefit.

Peter tried really hard to remain objective, but ultimately he knew he was diving head first into the flames of Hell. He knew what it meant. He knew it would end badly. But giving in, giving himself…Well, it felt good.

summary: a distant ship's smoke on the horizon
title: a distant ship's smoke on the horizon
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2D5PJ1d

by the_masked_hero

It’s moments like these—when Peter is so obviously hurting and trying to suppress it—that May doubts her parenting skills the most. She has no idea how to help him, to placate his pain and make everything sunshine and rainbows again. She takes two deep breaths, three—she shouldn’t be the anguished one here. She can’t be, because Peter needs her, and she’s failing, and it’s only getting worse—

(or: May is trying. She really is. The thing is, a certain purple genocidal alien has made things difficult for everyone, and May has no idea how to comfort Peter after everything he’s been through.)

Words: 1374, Chapters: 1/1, Language: English

  • Fandoms: Marvel Cinematic Universe, Spider-Man: Homecoming (2017)
  • Rating: Explicit
  • Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply
  • Categories: F/M
  • Characters: Peter Parker, May Parker (Spider-Man), Tony Stark (mentioned)
  • Relationships: May Parker (Spider-Man) & Peter Parker, Peter Parker & Tony Stark (mentioned)
  • Additional Tags: Hurt/Comfort, Emotional Hurt/Comfort, Angst, Angst and Hurt/Comfort, Peter Parker Needs a Hug, Peter Parker Gets a Hug, Precious Peter ParkerHugs

Find me on:
AO3: Takara_Phoenix || FFNet: Takara Phoenix || DA: Takara-Phoenix || Side Blog: Written in the Stars

summary: Tony Stark! Can't forget him :) (for the latest ask)
question: Tony Stark! Can't forget him :) (for the latest ask)
answer:
Never forget Tony Stark. That is a real motto. *nods*

How I feel about this character: I LOVE HIM. I love Tony Stark so very, very, very much. He’s my second favorite character. Like, of all times.

All the people I ship romantically with this character: *takes a deep breath* Bucky Barnes, Loki, T’Challa, Peter Quill, Thor, Stephen Strange, Sam Wilson, Steve Rogers (just, ya know, not in the MCU), Clint Barton (just, ya know, also not in the MCU), Bruce Banner, Janet van Dyne

My non-romantic OTP for this character: JAMES RHODES. Rhodey and Tony are such good bros, I love them so much??

My unpopular opinion about this character: Tony Stark deserves better than this fandom. Seriously, the amount of absolute idiots who just… stopped watching the MCU after the first half of Iron Man is insane… I really don’t understand how people can… watch a movie, but… just… not take anything in that happens in it… *shakes head*

One thing I wish would happen / had happened with this character in canon: I WISH THAT HE SURVIVES A4. YOU CAN NOT KILL MY TONY.

summary: I keep having dreams about seeing Avengers 4. One of them had the first half of the movie being about Pepper trying to hunt down...
body:
I keep having dreams about seeing Avengers 4. One of them had the first half of the movie being about Pepper trying to hunt down and save Tony in her Rescue gear.

Another involved Tony and Steve sneaking through some giant Alien ship together.
